sources.title: Lorna Doone (1922) Drama, Romance Silent Film
sources.description:
In 17th-century England, an outlaw gang kidnaps a young girl, who grows up among them. The farm boy who met her just before the kidnapping eventually rescues her, and they fall in love.

Director: Maurice Tourneur
Writers: R.D. Blackmore, Katherine S. Reed 
Stars: Madge Bellamy, John Bowers, Frank Keenan
Genre:  Classics, Drama, Period, Romance, Silent, 

Join the rest of the cult on social media :
Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/CultCinemaClassics
Insta : https://www.instagram.com/cultcinemaclassics -
https://www.twitch.tv/cultcinema

metadata.Plot: Lorna is a young noble girl who meets a young farmer boy named John Ridd. They immediately become infatuated with each other, but Lorna is kidnapped by the Doones, a group of bandits, and she is taken back to their village and raised as one of them. She is protected from the others by Sir Ensor Doone, the group's leader, because he has grown attached to her. After many years he becomes very ill and an upstart named Carver decides that he wants Lorna as his wife. Sir Ensor is powerless to protect her, so she must contact John to rescue her.
metadata.Writer: R.D. Blackmore, Katherine S. Reed, Cecil G. Mumford
metadata.Actors: Madge Bellamy, Mae Giraci, John Bowers
